alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 4:22AM AKST until February 23 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and rain expected with a chance for freezing rain along the Sterling Highway corridor. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until 5 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most likely area for freezing rain will be along the Sterling Highway corridor. Precipitation should be all rain toward Kachemak Bay.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
